page.title: 02THE HUMBER BRIDGE
page.content: {THE HUMBER BRIDGE _ IMPACT ON BARTON In July 1980 the final section of deck was put in place making the bridge the largest single span suspension bridge in the world. The new link with the North Bank has brought certain benefits to Barton by bringing Hull's facilities into easy reach.Another feature has been the steady trickle of home buyers moving from the North Bank to the less expensive South. The expected boost to tourism and industry has not lived up to expectations although the potential still remains. For the true Bartonians the bridge has had little real impact although at the same time it has brought benefits for those who want them without spoiling the nature of the town.
